subject: AI
title: Semantic Search
description: Finding documents by meaning, not just keywords.

hook.text: The user types 'how do I send back a product I bought?' Your keyword search for 'send back' returns nothing. Your knowledge base calls it 'returns.' Semantic search finds it anyway.

buildup.text: Semantic search embeds the query into the same vector space as your chunks and finds the nearest neighbors. It matches meaning, not exact words.

discovery.text: This is why RAG works for real users: people describe things in their own words, not in your documentation's terminology. Semantic search bridges that vocabulary gap.

twist.text: Semantic search can match too broadly. 'What's your refund policy?' might retrieve 'What's your privacy policy?' because the sentence structure is similar. Relevance scoring helps but isn't perfect.

climax.text: Semantic search is your primary retrieval method in RAG. Pair it with keyword search (hybrid retrieval) for cases where exact terminology matters.

punchline.text: People ask in their words. Your docs answer in yours. Semantic search translates between them.

quiz.question: What advantage does semantic search have over keyword search?
options: It matches meaning rather than exact words, bridging vocabulary gaps
